Description: One of eleven fragments, now completely reconstructed, of a polychrome glazed composition vase with rounded base and tall sides, tapering inwards towards mouth. The base is decorated with a black and green leaf design on a white ground; above this, a relief representation, yellow on a purple ground, of Ramses 3 receiving offerings, with cartouches above; above this, two bands of decoration, one of black leaf motifs on a purple ground and the other of black rosettes on a green ground.
Curator's comments: Part of 1905,1014. Petrie, Researches in Sinai, pl. 157 bottom
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Ramses III
